intro: Tonningia fasciculata, commonly known as the green sea whip, is a marine red algae found in tropical and subtropical waters. It belongs to the family Gigartinales and is characterized by its branched, filamentous structure. The plant typically grows in shallow coastal areas, attaching itself to rocks or other substrates. Its thallus is green to brown in color, and it plays a role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat for various small organisms. Tonningia fasciculata is also used in traditional medicine and as a source of agar.
